abilities.herbsInfo: Contains information about herbs, formulas and ingredients
abilities.allowCorrections: Allow users to provide subsequent corrections

inputExamples.smartRecommendation: I feel shortness of breath, vomiting, abdominal pain, and coughing. Is there any Chinese medicine that can treat it?
inputExamples.medicalCase: More than 30 years ago, the patient had cough, sputum, and wheezing without obvious causes. He went to the local hospital for treatment and improved after symptomatic treatment. Since then, the patient's cough, sputum, and wheezing symptoms have recurred, mostly aggravated when cold and seasonal changes, and the attack time is more than 3 months each year. He has been to the local hospital for treatment many times due to worsening of the condition. He was diagnosed with "chronic obstructive pulmonary disease" and improved after symptomatic treatment such as expectorant, asthma and anti-inflammatory drugs. 4 days ago, the patient had chest tightness and asthma aggravated after catching a cold, especially when moving. He coughed and coughed up a moderate amount of yellow sputum, had a low fever at night, and the highest body temperature was 37.8℃, without obvious chest pain. Self-medication with oral medication, the details are unknown. In order to seek further diagnosis and treatment, he came to our hospital today for treatment. The outpatient department was admitted to our district for inpatient system treatment for "acute exacerbation of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease". During the course of the patient's illness, there was no nausea and vomiting, no hemoptysis and chest pain, no edema in both lower limbs, normal appetite, normal sleep, and normal bowel movements. The patient is clear-minded, in good spirits, of moderate shape, with clear speech and rosy lips; the skin is normal without macules. The head is of normal size and shape, with no sunken eye sockets, no yellowing of the whites of the eyes, normal ear helices, no ear fistulas or sores; the neck is symmetrical, with no exposed blue veins, no goiters or scrofula, the chest is symmetrical, the pulse is normal, the abdomen is flat, without lumps or masses, the nails are rosy in color, and the lower limbs are fine. The patient had cough, sputum, and wheezing without obvious causes more than 30 years ago, and was treated in a local hospital. The symptoms improved after symptomatic treatment. Since then, the patient's cough, sputum, and wheezing symptoms have recurred, and they have worsened when exposed to cold and when the seasons change. The attacks last for more than 3 months each year. He has been treated in a local hospital many times due to worsening of the disease. He was diagnosed with "chronic obstructive pulmonary disease" and improved after symptomatic treatment such as expectorant, asthma-relieving and anti-inflammatory drugs. Four days ago, the patient had chest tightness and asthma after catching a cold, especially when moving. He coughed and coughed up a moderate amount of yellow sputum. He had a low fever at night, with a maximum temperature of 37.8℃ and no obvious chest pain. He took oral medication on his own, but the details are unknown. In order to seek further diagnosis and treatment, he came to our hospital today and was admitted to our hospital system for "acute exacerbation of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease" in the outpatient department. During the course of the patient's illness, there was no nausea and vomiting, no coughing up blood and chest pain, no edema in both lower limbs, normal appetite, normal sleep, and normal bowel movements. He was clear-minded, in good spirits, in good shape, with clear speech and rosy lips; his skin was normal, without macules. The head is normal in size and shape, without sunken eye sockets, no yellowing of the white of the eyes, normal earlobes, no ear fistulas or sores; the neck is symmetrical, without exposed veins, no goiters or scrofula, the chest is symmetrical, the pulse is normal, the abdomen is flat, without lumps or masses, the nails are ruddy in color, the lower limbs are not edematous, the tongue is pale red, the tongue coating is white, and the pulse is stringy and slippery. What are the dialectical methods and treatment methods?
inputExamples.entityExtraction: [Trade Name of Drug] Ginseng and Yimu Pills [Drug Name] Ginseng and Yimu Pills [Approval Number] National Medicine Standard Z21020194 [Ingredients] Motherwort, Angelica, Ginseng (Sugar Ginseng), Chuanxiong, Atractylodes (fried with bran), White Peony Root, Licorice, Rehmannia Glutinosa, Poria. Excipient is honey. [Specifications] Each pill weighs 10g [Usage and Dosage] Oral. 1 pill at a time, 3 times a day. [Adverse Reactions] Not yet clear. [Precautions] Pregnant women should not take it. [Pharmaceutical Company] Liaoning Jindan Pharmaceutical Co., Ltd. [43] Over-the-counter drugs (Class A) [Functions and Indications] Nourishes qi and blood, removes blood stasis and regulates menstruation. Used for women with qi and blood deficiency, irregular menstruation, weakness and fatigue, qi and blood deficiency, honey
